Tatiana Mac is an American designer who builds inclusive, accessible, and ethical products with thoughtful practices.

A designer who codes.
A writer who reads.
A speaker who listens.

Selected Writings

Bah-hum-blog.

The question to answer isn't, “Have I made a place where people have the freedom to express themselves?” Instead we have to ask, “Have I made a place where everyone has the safety to exist?”

Canary in a coal mine: How tech provides platforms for hate

I think we can forget what we are capable of and what we deserve when we’re sad. We end up dodging failure instead of reaching for radical success.

TRUST the Process: How to present your best, when you’re at your worst

But what if we were more okay accepting imperfect, in-progress, new things? Perhaps imposter syndrome would be less pervasive and there’d be less shame.

Why we need more beginners teaching

True vulnerability is a powerful tool for developing trust. It represents strength and security in who you are and what you bring to your work.

You lead like a girl: Defying the patriarchy with feminist leadership

Perpetual motion is good, but not if it's directionless. Methodical decision-making is also good, but not if it means stagnation. We are told to dream big, but rarely are we told to do small.

Progress over perfection: Something now over everything never
